creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: two stylized women standing near a column or street lamp; woman at L is in mid-stride holding a clutch purse at PR hand; woman at R facing woman at L with PR hand adjusting hair
image_copyright: © Estate Reginald Marsh %2F Artists Rights Society %28ARS%29%2C New York
inscription:
Signature, Inscription, Watermark

-- in graphite on verso: APG 8361
provenance: Given by artist to D.J. Simons. (C. & J. Goodfriend, New York; sold November 11, 1986, to Andrus); John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: signed and inscribed in graphite, below platemark: [Reg. Marsh / for D.J. Simons]; initialed in plate, lower right: [R.M. / A]
title: Two Girls
